<span id="getting-started"></span>
== <span id="Getting_Started" class="mw-headline">Getting Started</span> ==


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

Are you brand new and perhaps don't quite understand lightning? Do you not have your own node yet? Are you not yet in the Plebnet telegram group?


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

Please see the [[/plebnet.wiki/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Getting_started|Getting started]] page.


</div>
<br />


<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

<span id="claim-your-node"></span>
== <span id="Claim_your_node" class="mw-headline">Claim your node</span> ==


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

For telegram, DM [https://t.me/cheeserobot @cheeserobot] and then <code>/claim</code> your node (follow the instructions, you will need to sign a message with your node to prove you are owner of the node).


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

Then, in the [https://t.me/plebnet plebnet] group announce your node with <code>/node</code>. If you see your own node, success. Repeat in other groups which support CheeseRobot with <code>/node</code>.


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

Additionally, [https://amboss.space Amboss.space] is one of the best websites for looking up nodes and their basic information. People may go to Amboss to browse your node's info. You can claim your node on Amboss which will allow you personalize your node's profile and add additional information. Use these instructions: [[/plebnet.wiki/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Claim_on_Amboss|Claim on Amboss]]


</div>
<br />


<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

<span id="opening-channels"></span>
== <span id="Opening_Channels" class="mw-headline">Opening Channels</span> ==


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

The first question which a pleb has after (or even before) the node is synced &quot;'''who should I open channel with'''&quot;


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

I would say - '''with a mentor who is willing to spend time with you, teach you the ropes, mentor and guide you to be a better node runner'''


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

Of course in the age of google, internet, and instant gratification, this thought can be frowned upon but there is no replacement for a mentor in your journey as node runner.


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

For information relating to lightning channels, including methods to get inbound liquidity see: [[/plebnet.wiki/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Opening_channels|Opening channels]]


</div>

<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

<span id="balance-of-satoshis"></span>
== <span id="Balance_of_Satoshis" class="mw-headline">Balance of Satoshis</span> ==


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

Balance of Satoshis, or BoS, is a set of commands for working with LND balances. It can do similar things as interfaces like ThunderHub or RideTheLightning. However, your options are much wider with BoS, and you will need it if you want to set up a telegram bot with your node (to get notifications whenever channels are opened/closed, whenever you forward a payment, whenever your node goes offline, and to get automatic channel backups for safety).


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

For more information, and common BoS commands see: [[/plebnet.wiki/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Balance_of_Satoshis|Balance of Satoshis]].


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

[https://github.com/niteshbalusu11/BOS-Commands-Document See this excellent documentation for bos commands]


</div>
<div class="mw-content-ltr" lang="en" dir="ltr">

Installation: process for [[/plebnet.wiki/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Umbrel_-_Installing_BoS|Umbrel - Installing BoS]]. Includes instructions for setting up BoS telegram bot.


</div>
